properties.areaDesc: Whitley, KY; McCreary, KY; Bell, KY; Knox, KY
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 5:55AM EST until February 6 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Jackson KY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in JACKSON KY has extended the

* Flood Warning for Urban Areas and Small Streams in...
Bell County in southeastern Kentucky...
Central Knox County in southeastern Kentucky...
Southeastern McCreary County in south central Kentucky...
Whitley County in south central Kentucky...

* Until 300 PM EST Thursday.

* At 554 AM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain that has
cause flooding and the closing of several highways. Up to three
inches of rain have already fallen with another inch possible
through today.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Williamsburg, Barbourville, Pineville, Middlesboro, Whitley City,
Julip, Varilla, Swan Lake, Zion Hill, Ponza, Gausdale and Erose.
properties.instruction:
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, country roads, farmland, and other low lying
spots.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

A Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring. All
interested parties should take necessary precautions immediately.
